reason: The text mentions feeling overwhelmed and reaching for a 'coping thing,' implying a potentially harmful coping mechanism. While the specific nature and intent are unclear, the statement warrants concern and further investigation.

title: User Story: Suicide
content: Been feeling so low lately, like nothing matters. Reaching out because I know I need help. Talking to someone feels impossible, but I'm trying. Any advice?
reason: Expresses feelings of hopelessness and acknowledges a need for help, suggesting potential risk. The difficulty in talking to someone is a barrier to support.

title: User Story: Overdose
content: Just got out of the hospital. Witnessed an OD last night, scared me to death. Please, if you're struggling, reach out. There are people who care. Don't be afraid to ask for help. It's okay to not be okay. ❤️
reason: Witnessing an overdose can be a traumatic experience leading to psychological distress. The text encourages seeking help for struggles, implying the individual may be at risk.

title: User Story: Violence
content: Just saw a couple fighting on the street, shouting and shoving. Made me so anxious. Reminded me too much of my parents. Anyone else get triggered by stuff like that? Need to breathe...
reason: The text describes witnessing a fight and experiencing anxiety related to past experiences. While the individual expresses distress, there is no indication of immediate danger to themselves or others. The response focuses on managing their anxiety through breathing exercises.

title: User Story: Overdose
content: Saw someone OD downtown today. Scary stuff. Narcan saved them, thank goodness. Makes you realize how fragile things are. Learn CPR, folks. It could save a life.
reason: While Narcan was successful, the overdose event indicates a potential, ongoing risk of future overdoses for the individual involved and highlights the prevalence of substance abuse in the area.

title: User Story: Overdose
content: Saw someone OD downtown today. Scariest thing ever. Naloxone saved them, thank god. Please, learn CPR & carry Narcan if you can. It's not just "junkies," it's people. ❤️
reason: While naloxone was used to save the person, an overdose indicates a serious health risk with potentially fatal consequences. The event is described as 'scariest thing ever', which suggests a high level of immediate risk.

title: User Story: Violence

reason: Witnessing a fight is unsettling but doesn't indicate immediate, direct threat or danger to the speaker. It expresses concern about escalating violence in general.

title: User Story: Suicide
content: Sometimes it feels like I'm underwater. Everything's muffled and heavy. Reaching out for help feels impossible, but I know I need to. Anyone else feel this way?
reason: Expresses feelings of being overwhelmed and unable to reach out, which are potential indicators of suicidal ideation or a severe mental health crisis. The statement 'I know I need to' suggests awareness of the need for help, but the feeling of impossibility raises concern.

title: User Story: Overdose
content: Just saw the news about another OD in my town. Scared. Lost a friend last year, still hurts. If you're struggling, please reach out. There are people who care. You're not alone.
reason: Mentions overdose (OD) and expresses fear, indicating a potential risk of future overdose or related mental health crisis within the community. Also references past loss, increasing the overall distress.

title: User Story: Self-Harm
